p: The global distribution of arboviruses has received considerable attention from public health organizations after recent emergence events in several parts of the world [ 1, 2]. Bluetongue virus (BTV) is an arboviral disease in ruminants [ 3], caused by a member of the genus Orivirus in the family Reoviridae. The disease is transmitted among ruminants by the bites of biting midges of the genus Culicoides [ 4].
